summary: Federal student loan payments resumed in October 2023 after more than 3 years of pause due to COVID-19. As of January 2024, the Education Department held $1.5 trillion in federal loans for nearly 43 million borrowers. title: Federal Student Loans: Preliminary Observations on Borrower Repayment Practices after the Payment Pause
